newXwikiFun - (02:06): Hi  
newXwikiFun - (02:06): to all  
newXwikiFun - (02:06): I am new to xwiki  
newXwikiFun - (02:07): I have worked for quite sometime with mediawiki  
newXwikiFun - (02:07): and I thought that I should give a shot with xwiki  
newXwikiFun - (02:08): I have installed it and it seems very cool  
newXwikiFun - (02:08): the problem is that it lacks some good getting started development examples  
newXwikiFun - (02:09): can someone point to some tutorials or books ?  
newXwikiFun - (02:10): besides of course the \*.xwiki.org

mflorea1 - (10:57): guys, has any of you tried to run the selenium tests on FF3.6? I installed Selenium IDE 1.0.4 but build stll hangs at "Preparing Firefox profile...".

vmassol left at 11:01 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 11:04  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:12  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 11:24  
sdumitriu - (11:25): vmassol: I was thinking that we could do an interview with Chris Phelan (the opensolaris guy), WDYT?  
vmassol - (11:25): sdumitriu: yes good idea. The goal would be to put it where? On xwiki.org? somewhere else?  
sdumitriu - (11:25): Yes, maybe a blog article  
sdumitriu - (11:26): (on .org)  
vmassol - (11:26): if you want you can start preparing a set of 5-10 questions  
vmassol - (11:27): then I can review them to see if I have some additional ideas and we then send a mail to chris with them attached  
vmassol - (11:27): wdyt?  
sdumitriu - (11:28): K  
GillesSerasset joined #xwiki at 11:37  
vmassol - (11:42): ok I'll try to upgrade myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (11:46): hmm why is there already an rc2 dir over there?  
vmassol - (11:46): has someone started doing the upgrade?  
vmassol - (11:46): tmortagne, jvdrean?  
jvdrean - (11:47): not me  
tmortagne - (11:49): vmassol: i'm currently upgrading myxwiki.org  
tmortagne - (11:50): did not seen your message  
tmortagne - (11:50): i'm almost done  
vmassol - (11:50): ok, I asked eariler today who could do it  
vmassol - (11:50): I'm stopping  
vmassol - (11:50): I just did the wget of the war  
vmassol - (11:50): shall I remove it?  
tmortagne - (11:50): i removed it  
vmassol - (11:50): or leace it?  
vmassol - (11:50): ok  
tmortagne - (11:50): did not understood why it was here until i see your message :)  
tmortagne - (11:54): [migration] stopping myxwiki.org now  
tmortagne - (12:00): [migration] war migrated  
tmortagne - (12:01): some nullpointer exceptions in com.xpn.xwiki.render.filter.XWikiLinkFilter but it's probably "normal" i doubt we touched that  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:01  
tmortagne - (12:02): note that i did not copied annotations jars because it's creating conflict with some 2.2 components  
sdumitriu - (12:02): lucaa: No more annotations...  
lucaa - (12:03): tmortagne: did you try/  
lucaa - (12:03): ?  
lucaa - (12:03): does it actually fail?  
tmortagne - (12:03): lucaa: yep  
lucaa - (12:03): ok  
lucaa - (12:03): I'll update  
lucaa - (12:03): my backport  
tmortagne - (12:03): ok  
lucaa - (12:04): now everybody please please answer the separators mail, otherwise I close with ^. and commit. I don't want this again in 2.3 :)  
lucaa - (12:05): jvdrean: please log your opinion about object names (in the freenames mail), as we discussed the other day. And your opinion about separators. Thanks!  
lucaa - (12:07): tmortagne: I can't do it with components override as I thought I could last night, because of the types enum. It's gonna have to be a jar to replace the other jar. damn  
lucaa - (12:07): (i just realized)  
tmortagne - (12:07): lucaa: yes you can use component override  
tmortagne - (12:08): just make sure you have the proper txt file in your jar  
lucaa - (12:08): to add a new EntityType class?  
lucaa - (12:08): enum  
tmortagne - (12:08): this one is difficult  
tmortagne - (12:08): let me look something  
vmassol - (12:09): for this one you just need a new EntityType class file that you drop in WEB-INF/classes  
tmortagne - (12:09): no actually it's easu just need to put the .class file in classes folder  
tmortagne - (12:09): WEB-INF/classes/  
lucaa - (12:10): of course there are solutions, but it's not distributable, as an override jar would be  
lucaa - (12:10): it's harder to distribute, let's put it that way  
lucaa - (12:10): there are solutions  
vmassol - (12:10): it's 2 steps instead of 1  
vmassol - (12:10): but it's the same order of magnitude re easiness of install  
vmassol - (12:11): (you copy 2 files instead of 1)  
lucaa - (12:11): but how do you distribute such a thing?  
vmassol - (12:11): zip  
vmassol - (12:11): for ex  
vmassol - (12:11): with a README  
lucaa - (12:11): :)  
lucaa - (12:12): and how is that just as easy?  
lucaa - (12:12): :)  
lucaa - (12:12): anyway, there are solutions  
mflorea1 left at 12:12 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa - (12:12): back to js ftm  
vmassol - (12:12): you also need a README for 1 file  
vmassol - (12:12): so it's jsut 2 files instead of 1  
vmassol - (12:12): now if you really want to make it easy you need an installer :)  
vmassol - (12:13): (till we get the extension manager)  
lucaa - (12:13): then why am I still trying to build annotations installable clean as a .xar? I could just ask people to copy files around in the /resources/js, /templates web-inf lib and anywhere else?  
flaviusolaru left at 12:14 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (12:14): lucaa: you're diverging  
vmassol - (12:14): the pb we have today  
lucaa - (12:14): anyway, really there aren't alternatives for the bakport so it's pointless to discuss whether it's easy or hard. It's how it is  
vmassol - (12:14): is to install jar files  
vmassol - (12:14): not XAR  
vmassol - (12:14): we have no mechanism to install a jar right now  
lucaa - (12:14): it's to install an application I'd say  
vmassol - (12:14): (except from groovy, as an attachment)  
vmassol - (12:14): the plan for this is the etxension manager  
vmassol - (12:15): but it's not there  
vmassol - (12:15): so one jar or 2 jars is the same pb  
vmassol - (12:15): ie there's no way you can install them from a running xwiki  
vmassol - (12:15): and you need access to the server  
lucaa - (12:15): one jar or 2 jars is not the same problem if you need to spread them around a bunch of different folders, imo  
lucaa - (12:16): but I might be wrong  
lucaa - (12:16): especially in this case when its about 6 jar in a folder and a .class file in another folder  
lucaa - (12:16): it's about the length of the readme file / installation instructions, imo  
lucaa - (12:17): that's what I'm tralking about when I say difficult, not the ssh to the server  
lucaa - (12:17): assume you have ssh to the server, how complicated is it from there  
vmassol - (12:17): again  
vmassol - (12:17): 6 files or 7 is the same order of magnitude  
vmassol - (12:18): a different order of magnitude would be install from a running wiki vs access the server  
lucaa - (12:18): yes, I understand \_this\_, it's just that I'm talking about a different thing (read above)  
lucaa - (12:19): if it's not important, then we stop the discussion, but it also means it  
lucaa - (12:19): it  
vmassol - (12:19): as I also said if you really really want to make it easy, provide a sh file or bat file to do the copy for the user but IMO it's definitelty not need  
vmassol - (12:19): not needed  
vmassol - (12:19): for something we'll integrate in the platform in a few weeks  
lucaa - (12:19): it's not really important for me to try to make it easy for the client  
GillesSerasset left at 12:19 (Quit: Computer goes to sleep!  
xenon751 is now known as fmancinelli ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
lucaa - (12:20): the extension manager?  
vmassol - (12:20): no  
lucaa - (12:20): or the 4775 patch?  
vmassol - (12:20): the annotations  
lucaa - (12:20): oh we're integrating in the platform, distributing bundled  
lucaa - (12:20): ?  
lucaa - (12:20): (I must have not read the latest roadmap)  
vmassol - (12:21): no idea about the bundle part  
vmassol - (12:21): it remains to be decided  
vmassol - (12:21): but the integration definitely  
lucaa - (12:21): so why would that make a difference in terms of installation?  
lucaa - (12:21): (I don't understand...)  
vmassol - (12:22): because you wouldn't have a pb with EntityType  
tmortagne - (12:22): wasn't the fact that you get redirected to the administration home page when you delete an attachment in import page supposed to be fixed ?  
lucaa - (12:22): vmassol: well, I only need commited XWIKI-4775, to not have a pb with entitytype, not integrated annotations  
vmassol - (12:23): lucaa: that's what I call integration + the fact that it's committed in platform/  
lucaa - (12:23): ok  
vmassol - (12:23): the 6 jars stuff is strange though, we'll need to check it out  
vmassol - (12:24): (ATM I don't understand why we'd need that many jars flying around)  
lucaa - (12:25): vmassol: it's just a matter of packing, it's different parts of the annotations module, which can be maven magic packed as a single one (and very probably should)  
vmassol - (12:25): I still don't understand why they're packaged separately  
vmassol - (12:25): do we have use cases for using only some jars and not others?  
lucaa - (12:25): only for some of them  
lucaa - (12:26): some others can be packed together  
lucaa - (12:26): I think we could do a minimum of 3  
vmassol - (12:27): ok we can talk about this when you send the integration email  
lucaa - (12:27): ok  
vmassol - (12:28): jvelociter: any idea re tmortagne's question?  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 12:32  
vmassol - (12:46): jvdrean: we don't receive watchlist emails for myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (12:47): just saw we had some spam on the home page!!!  
bbc581 joined #xwiki at 12:48  
vmassol - (12:50): myxwiki.org just went down, is that normal?  
tmortagne - (12:52): vmassol: works well for me  
vmassol - (12:52): yes it's back now  
vmassol - (12:52): it was stopped for about 1-2 mn  
tmortagne - (12:52): maybe it has been restarted

tmortagne - (12:52): [migration] finished  
vmassol - (12:53): I like it when it's fast like it is now  
jvdrean left at 12:53 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (12:56): and now luch time  
vmassol - (12:57): cool thx thomas for the upgrade  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:58  
tmortagne - (12:59): i did not seen anything wrong (anything very important at least) yet  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:02  
GillesSerasset joined #xwiki at 13:22  
SvenDowiu is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
fmancinelli left at 13:30 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (13:37): vmassol: I have some commits for the colibri skin which will make the current branch unusable for 2.2  
sdumitriu - (13:37): Should I push them now?  
vmassol - (13:46): well if you do and we need to use a recent version of the colbiri skin we'd need to branch it then. There's the risk that we'll forget too. We should see with thomas since he's the one who'll release the 2.2 final on Monday  
vmassol - (13:47): as a general rule we should try to keep the apps/skins/plugins backward compat as much as possible  
vmassol - (13:47): isn't it possible?  
sdumitriu - (13:48): Not really  
sdumitriu - (13:48): Web->Space deprecation was done only on 2.3  
vmassol - (13:49): you could do what we did for the syntax factory but it's not very nice  
vmassol - (13:49): a bit cumbersome  
vmassol - (13:50): wait  
vmassol - (13:50): no  
vmassol - (13:50): forget that  
vmassol - (13:50): thinking more  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 13:57  
vmassol - (13:58): about to delete a few hundreds of users on myxwiki.org that have first name = last name, ok?  
vmassol - (13:58): you can check them here: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/DeleteSpamUsers  
glerouge - (13:59): I think you can go ahead  
vmassol - (14:01): sdumitriu: ok?  
sdumitriu - (14:02): Checking  
vmassol - (14:03): I think my script will still have them in the trash  
sdumitriu - (14:03): Can't harm  
sdumitriu - (14:03): Never saw a useful contribution from such users  
vmassol - (14:04): do you think I should keep them in the trash or not?  
sdumitriu - (14:04): Don't know, your call  
vmassol - (14:04): ok  
sdumitriu - (14:04): Don't forget to clean AllUsers  
vmassol - (14:05): ah right, I had forgotten  
sdumitriu - (14:06): I wonder if it's done automatically  
vmassol - (14:06): I doubt it  
vmassol - (14:06): answer is no  
vmassol - (14:06): wait  
vmassol - (14:06): need to check if there's any event listener  
jvdrean - (14:06): I think there's an listener in the rightsmanager plugin  
vmassol - (14:07): yes  
vmassol - (14:07): seems it's doing it  
vmassol - (14:07): I'll check the result  
vmassol - (14:09): grr down again  
vmassol - (14:10): maybe the restart script is too strict  
vmassol - (14:11): it's back  
vmassol - (14:11): cool the delete in allgroups was done automatically  
vmassol - (14:11): that's very cool  
tmortagne - (14:15): vmassol: rightsmanager plugin automatically lean rights and groups objects  
tmortagne - (14:15): \*clean  
vmassol - (14:16): tmortagne: do you remember if this feature was avail in 2.0.2 too?  
tmortagne - (14:17): this feature is pretty old actually, i implemented this when we did the first version of the  new rights/user/groups UI  
tmortagne - (14:17): something like 1.3 or something  
tmortagne - (14:18): note we need to make it look at all wikis since i think i made it only for the current wiki i think  
tmortagne - (14:19): (even if we usually use groups instead of users from main wiki when configuring rights so it's ok for now)  
jvelociter - (14:29): vmassol: tmortagne did not fix anything re deleting an attachment in import  
jvelociter - (14:30): is there a JIMRA issue for that ?  
tmortagne - (14:30): jvelociter: i 'm pretty sure there is one yes and i tough i seen it closed by someone  
tmortagne - (14:30): let me try to find it  
tmortagne - (14:33): jvelociter: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAADMINISTRATION-71 indeed it's not closed  
jvelociter - (14:33): ok I'm taking it  
tmortagne - (14:34): ok cool  
vmassol - (14:39): cool now http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/DeleteSpamUsers is performant  
vmassol - (14:40): first time I'm writing a subquery in hql... ;)  
anamarias - (14:46): I have a method in Velocity that returns either a list of objects or null (in case of failure)  
anamarias - (14:46): How do I check if a null was returned without calling it twice?  
anamarias - (14:46): For string results was simple, do #set($res = "$!obj.method()") ... but here I have a list of objects in the normal case  
sdumitriu - (14:47): What version of XWiki?  
sdumitriu - (14:47): Actually forget that  
anamarias - (14:47): 2.3-snap  
sdumitriu - (14:48): Try this:  
sdumitriu - (14:48): #set($x = '')  
sdumitriu - (14:48): #set($x = $the.method())  
sdumitriu - (14:48): #if("$!x" != '')  
sdumitriu - (14:48): Good  
sdumitriu - (14:48): #end  
sdumitriu - (14:48): Works for all versions  
tmortagne - (14:49): wouldn't #if($x != '') enouth  (instead of  #if($x != '')) ?  
sdumitriu - (14:51): tmortagne: Rephrase  
tmortagne - (14:51): indeed it's not very good:  
tmortagne - (14:52): isn't #if($x != '') enough instead of #if($x != '')  
tmortagne - (14:52): haa  
tmortagne - (14:52): crap  
tmortagne - (14:52):  isn't #if($x != '') enough instead of #if("$!x" != '')  
tmortagne - (14:52): i fiw it each time i'm trying to write it :)  
tmortagne - (14:52): no need to print the list  
tmortagne - (14:53): if it's a list if will not be equals to ''  
tmortagne - (14:53): "$!x" will call tostring on the returned list  
anamarias - (14:54): tmortagne: it doesn't work  
anamarias - (14:54): like this #if($x != ''), because x won't keep the '' value after the second init  
anamarias - (14:54): but this one : #if("$!x" != '') works just fine  
tmortagne - (14:55): ho ye sin the new version because of null support  
tmortagne - (14:55): forgot that  
tmortagne - (14:56): you could do #if ($x && $x != '') then  
sdumitriu - (14:56): If it's only for the new version, then this one should work:  
sdumitriu - (14:56): #set($x = $the.method())  
sdumitriu - (14:56): #if($x)  
sdumitriu - (14:56): Good  
sdumitriu - (14:56): #end  
tmortagne - (14:56): #if ($x && $x != '') shoulw work for both without the need to call tostring  
sdumitriu - (14:57): Fails  
sdumitriu - (14:57): if $x == '', then #if($x) fails  
sdumitriu - (14:58): Hm, wait  
tmortagne - (14:58): sdumitriu: yes that's the point, if it queals '' it's not good  
sdumitriu - (14:58): My bad  
tmortagne - (14:58): basically it's a merge of what you would do in both versions ;)  
sdumitriu - (14:59): So yes, #if($x && $x != '') should work  
anamarias - (14:59): for this version:  
sdumitriu - (14:59): And it doesn't use toString  
anamarias - (14:59):  #set($x = '')  
anamarias - (14:59): #set($x = $the.method())  
anamarias - (14:59): #if("$!x" != '')  
anamarias - (14:59): do I need the first #set($x = '') ?  
sdumitriu - (14:59): No  
anamarias - (14:59): looks like it works without  
sdumitriu - (15:00): That's needed for 2.1 and earlier  
xenon75 joined #xwiki at 15:00  
vmassol - (15:00): sdumitriu: should we also remove users which have empty first and last names? http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/DeleteSpamUsers  
tmortagne - (15:00): anamarias: in this version you can just do #if($x) as sdumitriusaid  
sdumitriu - (15:01): vmassol: Yes  
anamarias - (15:01): i'm not sure if it's only for this version, so i'll use the old way  
vmassol - (15:01): sdumitriu: I'm about to delete this full list, ok?  
sdumitriu - (15:02): OK  
sdumitriu - (15:02): Nothing important would be gone  
sdumitriu - (15:02): Users can re-register if they want  
vmassol - (15:02): yes  
vmassol - (15:03): the irc spam is starting  
vmassol - (15:04): a single delete is really long  
sdumitriu - (15:04): Yes, what takes much is saving XWikiAllGroup  
vmassol - (15:04): we should check what the pb is  
sdumitriu - (15:04): Since object load/save is inefficient  
vmassol - (15:04): ok  
vmassol - (15:04): I could stop the bot  
vmassol - (15:05): anyone wants to stop the bot?  
sdumitriu - (15:05): One query for each property  
sdumitriu - (15:05): It's not a problem for me  
vmassol - (15:05): the good part is that since it's long, the bot won't be ejected for flooding ;)  
sdumitriu - (15:06): It won't, anyway  
sdumitriu - (15:06): Since it's registered  
sdumitriu - (15:06): (at least it used to be when I last worked on it)  
sdumitriu - (15:08): vmassol: I think Caleb started a patch for the object performance  
vmassol - (15:08): sdumitriu: I think so too  
sdumitriu - (15:08): Let's see if the save time goes down after deleting all the users  
arkub left at 15:10 (Quit: Leaving  
vmassol - (15:10): hmm this seems to be impacting xwiki.org quite a lot  
vmassol - (15:11): it's very slow for me now  
arkub joined #xwiki at 15:12  
glerouge - (15:12): quitting: excess fl00d in the chat  
glerouge left #xwiki at 15:12  
tmortagne - (15:12): we should really make XWikiAllGroup fully virtual by default some day...  
sdumitriu - (15:13): I don't think it can be done on xwiki.org  
flaviusolaru left at 15:13 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu - (15:13): It should be upgraded first  
sdumitriu - (15:13): But yes, it can be done already, just that it isn't so by default  
tmortagne - (15:14): sdumitriu: even with last version it's still not fully virtual by default  
arkub left at 15:15 (Read error: No route to host  
tmortagne - (15:15): we should not even provide the XWikiAllGroup document and have it in a special part of the rights management UI like with guest user
